title: Lesley Roy set to arrive in Rotterdam today ahead of Eurovision performance
text:
Lesley Roy set to arrive in Rotterdam today ahead of Eurovision performance
Ireland's Eurovision hopeful Lesley Roy will arrive in Rotterdam today as she kicks off her long-awaited bid for glory.
After missing out on her chance last year, the Dubliner will arrive to the Eurovision host city this weekend.
The Balbriggan born singer-songwriter will take to the stage for the first time tomorrow, for her first rehearsal of Irelandâ€™s 2021 entry, Maps, on stage at the Rotterdam Ahoy Arena.
Speaking ahead of her arrival, she said: â€śWe are very excited to arrive in Rotterdam. It has been a long build-up to getting there and itâ€™s finally happening.
â€śWe are thrilled with the song and the staging and really looking forward to getting up there and performing.â€?
Support
Roy was due to head to the competition with Story of My Life, last year before the pandemic put a stall to the competition.
And after disappointment last year, she thanked fans for their support as she makes her journey to the world stage at last.
She added: â€śIâ€™m so appreciative of all the support from everyone in Ireland on the road to getting here.
â€śIâ€™m hoping to do Ireland proud this year, and that everyone at home can tune in.â€?
Meanwhile, Maps has been garnering lots of support online, as it passed one million streams, and the song video is edging close to a million views on YouTube before the competition even kicks off.
Lesley, who has worked with some of the biggest stars in the business, including the likes of Katy Perry and Max Martin, has a packed schedule of rehearsals and virtual events, while in Rotterdam.
This will include an online event hosted by the Irish Embassy in The Netherlands on May 12.
Vote
On Tuesday, May 18, Ireland will compete in the first semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest, with 16 countries participating.
Those countries plus Germany, Italy and the Netherlands will vote in this semi-final.
Marty Whelan will provide commentary for both of the semi-finals and the grand-final on RTĂ‰ One on Saturday, May 22.
